meanings.sent1: After cheering loudly at the game, his voice became hoarse.
meanings.sent2: The hoarse wind howled through the night.
meanings.sent3: The hoarse engine of the old car sputtered and coughed.
meanings.sent4: The hoarse laughter of the witch echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent5: The hoarse cry of the crow pierced the silence of the morning.

meanings.sent1: The hoarse singer struggled to hit the high notes.
meanings.sent2: Her hoarse voice was a result of shouting at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The hoarse cat meowed in a comical way.
meanings.sent4: His hoarse voice grated on her nerves during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The hoarse tone of his voice made it difficult to understand him.

meanings.definition: To make a rough, harsh sound, as the voice
meanings.sent1: She hoarsed out a warning to her friend in a whisper.
meanings.sent2: The baby hoarsed loudly when he wanted attention.
meanings.sent3: The comedian hoarsed his voice for a funny impression.
meanings.sent4: The old door hoarsed as it opened slowly.
meanings.sent5: The singer hoarsed out the final note with emotion.
